Groups.Group: Internet Security Benchmarks + Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Level 1

Patch.Name: Set SSH HostbasedAuthentication to No (Detect Only)

Advanced.DetectScript:
#!/bin/bash RV=0 REASON="SSH HostbasedAuthentication is not set to NO" EXPECT="Set SSH HostbasedAuthentication to No"
egrep -q "^HostbasedAuthentication +no" /etc/ssh/sshd_config if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then RV=1 fi if [ $RV -eq 1 ]; then echo $REASON >&1 echo $EXPECT >&2 fi exit $RV

Vulnerability.Title: Set SSH HostbasedAuthentication to No
Vulnerability.Description:
The HostbasedAuthentication parameter specifies if authentication is allowed through trusted hosts via the user of .rhosts, or /etc/hosts.equiv, along with successful public key client host authentication. This option only applies to SSH Protocol Version 2.
Note: This content will only provide detection of the security threat or vulnerability. Remediation must be performed manually.
